lead_paragraph: The seemingly ever-expanding investigation into insider trading -- built on aggressive techniques like wiretapping and embracing a more sweeping definition of the crime -- was surely meant by the federal authorities to inspire fear on Wall Street.
snippet: Federal authorities want their insider trading inquiry to inspire fear on Wall Street. But financial executives told The New York Observer they are less than impressed.

headline.main: Faced With a Big Investigation, Wall Street Shrugs

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: Federal authorities want their insider trading inquiry to inspire fear on Wall Street. But financial executives told The New York Observer they are less than impressed.
